clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used in patients with homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia as an adjunct to diet and other lipid lowering medications

contraindications.disease: The FDA label includes a black box warning of mipomersem induced hepatoxicity Other less serious adverse effects include nausea headache fatigue local injection site reactions and flu like symptoms
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Mipomersen sodium decreases the levels of apolipoprotein B apo B low density lipoprotein LDL non high density lipoprotein cholesterol and total cholesterol

incompatibilities.description: Doxycycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Lymecycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Clomocycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Tigecycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Oxytetracycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Demeclocycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Tetracycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Metacycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Minocycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Rolitetracycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Sarecycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Eravacycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Omadacycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Penimepicycline may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Acetaminophen may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Propacetamol may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Mipomersen may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Methotrexate
Tamoxifen may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Isotretinoin may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Amiodarone may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Lomitapide may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Ethanol may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Mipomersen
Mipomersen may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Pexidartinib
